title: Guardsman Pass
text:
Guardsman Pass (elevation is a high <a href="mountain%20pass">mountain pass</a> in the <a href="Wasatch%20Mountains">Wasatch Mountains</a> of Utah. The pass is located on the boundaries of the <a href="Uinta-Wasatch-Cache%20National%20Forest">Uinta-Wasatch-Cache National Forest</a> (specifically the portion known as the <a href="Wasatch%20National%20Forest">Wasatch National Forest</a>) to the west, and the <a href="Bonanza%20Flats">Bonanza Flats</a> <a href="backcountry">backcountry</a> area to the east.
It is located just south of <a href="Tri-County%20Peak">Tri-County Peak</a>, where Summit, Wasatch, and Salt Lake counties meet, and also provides summer <a href="hiking">hiking</a> and winter <a href="snowmobiling">snowmobiling</a> access to <a href="Clayton%20Peak">Clayton Peak</a> at the top of Brighton ski area. It is also a <a href="trailhead">trailhead</a> for other trails in the area, though some are being moved due to the lack of space for <a href="parking">parking</a> and the limited <a href="sight%20distance">sight distance</a> for vehicles pulling out onto the roadway.
Access.
Guardsman Pass is traversed by Guardsman Pass Road, which is also designated as <a href="SR-190%20%28UT%29">Utah 190</a> west (and formerly east) of the pass. Due to heavy amounts of <a href="snow">snow</a> at the high elevation of the pass, this road is closed in winter, generally from November to May but depending on actual conditions each year.
This road connects to <a href="Big%20Cottonwood%20Canyon">Big Cottonwood Canyon</a> on the west side of the pass. On the east side, it connects to <a href="Midway%2C%20Utah">Midway</a> via Pine Canyon Road and <a href="SR-222%20%28UT%29">Utah 222</a>, and to <a href="Park%20City%2C%20Utah">Park City</a> via <a href="SR-224%20%28UT%29">Utah 224</a> over nearby <a href="Empire%20Pass">Empire Pass</a>.
Wasatch county paved the last unpaved section of the road over just a few days in late September 2018, also installing around of <a href="guard%20rail">guard rail</a>. This section from the pass to 224 is immediately below <a href="Pinyon%20Ridge">Pinyon Ridge</a> (including Jupiter Hill) which divides Wasatch and Summit counties, and is the southern boundary for the <a href="Park%20City%20Mountain%20Resort">Park City Mountain Resort</a> and part of <a href="Deer%20Valley%20Resort">Deer Valley Resort</a> ski areas.
